metadata.subject: Fwd: Alert: The 2017 Tax Reform Act

organizations: U.S. House Committee on Oversight and Accountability
locations: 575 Lexington Avenue 4th Floor, New York, NY 10022
551 Fifth Avenue, 21st Floor, New York, NY 10176

relationships.description: Kahn is forwarding tax information to Epstein
Law firm providing tax alert to Kahn who is forwarding it

analysis.purpose: To forward a comprehensive tax alert about the 2017 Tax Reform Act and its impact on fund managers and their funds
analysis.significance: Detailed analysis of major tax law changes affecting investment funds, carried interest, and international tax provisions

notable_quotes: The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act (the 'Tax Act'), which was signed into law by President Trump on December 22, 2017, contains the most sweeping federal tax law changes since 1986.
The change in carried interest taxation clearly impacts managers of hedge funds more than managers of private equity funds or real estate funds.

Since the new 21% corporate tax rate is now well below the highest rate applicable to high income individuals, some investment managers may conclude that some or all of their management entities should convert to corporate form.
red_flags: Potential tax shelter strategies using C corporations

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found - this is a professional tax advisory communication

illegal_activity.description: Document contains legal tax analysis and planning strategies - no evidence of illegal activity

public_knowledge.context: The 2017 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act was widely publicized legislation, and this document contains standard tax analysis that would be typical for financial professionals

analysis.summary: Richard Kahn forwards a detailed tax alert from Sadis & Goldberg LLP analyzing the 2017 Tax Reform Act's impact on fund managers, covering carried interest changes, corporate tax rates, international tax provisions, and various tax planning considerations for investment funds and their managers.
